Entries.default: "Ishi, stop pecking at Serafen's beard."
"So... read anything good lately?"
"I think Ishiza has been nesting with the pages of your grimoire."
"I told Ishiza to apologize for that... incident with your book."
"Sorry for that one time I shot you in the leg."
"Been a while since we crossed cannons, Serafen."
"So you served on the Sorcerer, but you aren't too keen on slavery?"
"You ever long for the simple life, soldier?"
"You're giving Ishi a weird look. What did he do?"
"Ishi, down! Edér, what are you hiding in your pack?"
"Hey firefly, catch!"
"You ever wonder if it's unhealthy to carry a lantern full of lost souls?"
"Anyone teach you how to tie a bowline, firefly?"
"Since the Gentleman out-sailed that Rauatai scow off of Hasongo, if I rightly recall."
"Us sharing a crew saves me a bullet I'll need elsewhere. So, thanks."
"In all fairness, I thought I was aiming at a hairy powder barrel."
"Blood under the bridge, lass. Even if you near robbed me of my favorite bits."
"Aye... We all were. The Sorcerer hunted every slaver we heard tell of..."
"I thought I heard... ah, it's nothing."
"Any attention - ach! - be good attention, lass. Ow!"
"Nah, where I'm from, sometimes the simple life comes knocking on your door with nooses and pitchforks."
"I'm not giving him a weird look, he's giving me a weird look."
"Huh, didn't think Ishi knew how to smoke."
"Huh?! Wha-? Wait, did you even toss me anything?"
"You mean like if I keep at it, they're going to do something worse than give me nightmares?"
"Can't say that they have. But I'm always willing to learn new tricks."
"A riveting essay on the properties of illusion. Oh, and Caedebald's treatise on the finer points of corrosives..."
"Couldn't you control him? You don't see me plucking his feathers for extra quills."
"It's quite all right. I appreciate the gesture."
"Most of the avian godlike I've met were poets and singers."
"Wager I can reload faster than you can draw your sword."
"Your 'mother' gave you quite the ego."
"You wouldn't survive a day in the navy, fish boy."
"What does watershaping feel like, Tekēhu?"
"Which one do you think I am?"
"Tonderie. I have no interest in your childish games."
"One of many gifts, I say."
"Ekera, I would rather give myself to the sea than take orders."
"Ekera, it is like making love to a bloom of jellyfish."
"Don't mind me. Just testing your reflexes."
"I suppose we're past the point of unhealthy."
"I'll show you. Could save your life one day. Or mine."
"Someone's egg rolled out of the nest."
"That wasn't a compliment, but... never mind."
"In that case, I'd give you an hour."
"I... may have missed my calling."
"Like a thousand wet kisses with a delicate caress under the skin."
"Glad I asked."
"You're free to try, but I'm telling you right now you'll regret it."
"Just say the word and I'll give him a kick in the tailfeathers."
"...Maybe not that gesture."
"Who's a good bird? Ouch!"
"Any time, lass."
"Ishi, are you staring at the captain? That's my job."
"Captain, how's about you let me aim the cannons next time?"
"Captain, you ever seen a Rauataian naval ram go to work on an enemy hull?"
"Stand down, little soldier."
"I swear I can hit the right spot at a distance."
"What am I saying? Course you have."
"Heard about that stunt you pulled in Queen's Berth, scaring everyone half to death."
"Tell me, do the spirits watch everything you do?"
"Ishi, how much of the captain's hard tack have you eaten?"
"You're gonna make yourself sick again, foolish bird."
"Like... everything everything?"
"You've got principles for someone whose job is guarding a bunch of merchants."
"And you have the principles of someone who guards warmongers. That is to say, none."
"Does the company pay you for mercenary duty, or is pride enough to buy bread where you're from?"
"Do you really not know the brotherhood reports directly to the ducs, or have the discharges of your gun knocked around your brain too much?"
"It was a special request to have your bird captured and held hostage until you stop asking me stupid questions."
"I saw you send off that missive. What are you telling the company now?"
"Caught you staring, firefly. Got something on your mind?"
"Something's not agreeing with me. You got any remedies for a stomach bug, firefly?"
"I've never seen Ishiza get this close to someone. He hasn't even pecked you yet."
"Ishi and I had a heart to heart, like you said. Talked about dreams and all that."
"What, that's wrong or something? Like I shouldn't be looking at you?"
"Well, the way you keep circling me like a hungry tiger makes Ishi nervous. Not that I mind."
"All right, maybe I'm thinking of doing a little more than looking. And if Ishi knows what's good for him, he'll hop on out of the way."
"My ma used to brew us murkberry tea mixed with hagfish oil. If that doesn't work, I can pray for you."
"I'll take that first one. I think Eothas is a little preoccupied."
"Poor, Maia. But don't you worry none, if you're needing to puke, that tea'll do the trick every time."
"Ishi sure is the sweetest, ain't he? And he's such a handsome little fella, too. Yes, he is."
"I guess it's just easy being nice to the girl with a pocket full of murkberries."
"Well, it's not just that. Me and Ishi have an understanding. I tell him about all my dreams and wishes. And the places I want to travel with him."
"Hmm."
"Oh, how'd it go? Did Ishi seem to like it?"
"He pecked me but didn't draw blood. I might call that progress?"
"That sort of behavior's just unbecoming. I'll talk to him about being ugly to his mama."
"He likes to listen."
"You're too good to me, firefly."
"Captain, a moment? I've got a job needs handling."
